content.description: Chippy, original name unknown, is a straightforward, holds abounding, 5.8ish romp up good granite past 6 or 8 bolts to a two bolt anchor on a pillar in the center of the area. The crux is about 2/3 the way up, just a little more reach than the rest of the climb.
content.protection: 6-8 bolts with two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: In a recess between a large cave on the left and a sharp overhang and abuttment to the right is a series of cracks and dihedrals. This route climbs the blocky pillar in the middle.

content.description: Shady forested, very secluded maze of islanded cliffs, 15 minute walk from the south side of lake lincoln. The path is not well traveled, a little bush wacking, so stay low on the hillside above the lake and you'll bend around east to the rocks. There are bolted routes primarily in this area with a few cracks that would be protectable. Height in range 10-50 feet.  Some moss on slab, but solid black granite, blocky in places. Routes range from 5.6 to 5.11.
